titleStmt.title: J. W. Weatherford to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG13829

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.idno: QMG Box 10; Folder Some 1862, 1863, Misc. Correspondence, Recommendation for Jobs, Claims for Pay, Vouchers for Expenses...Few on Ordinance

body.p: In my hurry to get off this morning I neglected to finish my business with you.

I need the Regt Comisary Comisioned and recomend to you George. F. Cunningham who was a first Lt in the old Regiment and a No one business man he has been acting for some time but cannot Rect for any thing until Comisiond

also recomend that you send to Dr A, C. Weatherford at Lebanon authority to be examined as an ast Surgeon by a Act of Congress passed in Jan Last Regiments are alled One Surgeon and two asts Dr W. has been attending to my sick for a month back. I will shape the Regiment up now as soon
as posible and hope to Come out with as good acharater as I have heretofore done.

Yours. Very. Resply.
J. W. Weatherford
Comd. 13.th Ky Vol. Cav.
Lebanon Ky.
1. 2. 3. 4. 5. George F. Cunningham Comy. 13 Cavy Octr. 16. 1863

13th Cavy
1 Lieut & Comy. Cunnigham
Com. issd. & forwd Octr 16th 1863
Issue desired commission and give letter.
